column2: We are specifically looking for applicants who have completed their MPHIL and possess an RCI License. The successful candidate must be able to commit to a full-time position. As a Clinical Psychologist at Karma Centre, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact in the lives of individuals seeking support.Responsibilities:      Conduct brief individual therapy sessions to address a variety of psychological concerns     Perform psychological assessments in multiple areas to provide comprehensive evaluations     Work effectively with children, both individually and in group settings     Conduct awareness programs, webinars, and sessions in diverse settings to promote mental health education     Design workshops, create psychology-related content, and deliver engaging presentations     Remuneration and Benefits:We offer competitive remuneration packages based on industry standards and commensurate with years of experience. Additionally, we provide a supportive work environment that fosters professional growth and ongoing development opportunities.Location:Our office is conveniently located in Vasant Vihar, New Delhi. Preference will be given to candidates who are based in Delhi or can easily commute to our office.   Preference will be given to those candidates who are from the queer and trans community.   If you are a passionate Clinical Psychologist dedicated to providing quality care and making a positive impact in the mental health field, we invite you to join our team at Karma Centre for Counselling.To apply for this position, please submit your updated CV and a cover letter to [email protected] Please include Queer Affirmative Clinical Psychologist Application in the subject line.We look forward to hearing from you soon!Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further assessment.    Job Features    Job Category Psychologist Pay 40,000 - 60,000 per month (Remuneration paid is based on industry standards, previous work experience and years of experience) Job Type Full-Time Timings 9AM - 6PM, 5.5 days per week Location Vasant Vihar, Delhi                Full-Time Clinical Psychologist     Responsibilities:      Conduct brief individual therapy sessions to address a variety of psychological concerns         Perform psychological assessments in multiple areas to provide comprehensive evaluations         Work effectively with children, both individually and in group settings         Conduct awareness programs, webinars, and sessions in diverse settings to promote mental health education         Design workshops, create psychology-related content, and deliver engaging presentations

column2: As a Senior Counselling Psychologist, you will be responsible for providing counselling, psychotherapy and follow up care to individual adults along with formulating treatment plans and crisis intervention for them.      Masters/ M.Phil Degree in Psychology      5+ years of experience as a Counselling Psychologist having worked with adults.      Minimum 3 Indian Languages preferred.      Excellent multitasking skills      Good time-management skills      Attention to detail      Great leadership skills      Passionate to work in mental health space      Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.      Compassion, empathy and cultural sensitivity.      Ability to treat patients with respect and understanding.      Being non-judgemental and professionalism are much appreciated.      We appreciate individuals who can take on initiative and responsibility.      We welcome openness to failure - for there is no better teacher!      Evaluate mental and emotional disorders and provide counselling, psychotherapy and follow-up care to adults.      Formulate plans of treatment, and provide referral to other mental health professionals based on assessments.      Provide crisis intervention in situations requiring immediate psychological treatment.      Participate in educational programs, in-service meetings, clinician meetings, and workshops to enhance professional development.      Instruct and direct students serving psychological internships.      Train junior therapists and mental health professionals.      Develop and implement non clinical research programs and studies      Develop, manage and implement mental health projects in collaboration with other professionals.      Maintain a social and medical profile on the Internet and different social media platforms.      Attend and participate in peer supervision, and continuous learning.      Evaluate future potential psychologists that enter the ecosystem.      Consults with other therapists and related professional and paraprofessional staff in the performance of therapeutic & managerial roles and casework.      Competitive Compensation      This is a full-time role at Heart It Out- 8 hours of work daily, 5 days per week.      At present, this position is being offered on a hybrid basis (virtually/in person).      Generous Holiday      Feel Invested      Office Parties & Outings      Birthday Gifts      Pet Friendly Office

column2: We are at an exciting juncture in our growth trajectory, rapidly emerging as a leading force in the mental health sector.        We are committed to dismantling the barriers that keep people from seeking help and breaking the stigma that surrounds mental health. Our team is making quality mental health care accessible to all, through innovative solutions and empathetic care.        We are seeking an RCI Certified Clinical Psychologist for a Consultant role, who will help us further our mission and expand our impact. As an integral member of our compassionate team, you will offer direct clinical care to patients, co-develop mental health programs, and deliver psychoeducation content.      This role will offer you a unique opportunity to make a tangible difference in the mental health landscape of our country.              Key Responsibilities include:              Providing direct clinical care to patients.        Developing and implementing comprehensive mental health programs.        Creating and delivering psychoeducation content in collaboration with counseling psychologists.        Training and supervising counseling psychologists within the team.        Promptly and accurately documenting patient encounters in our electronic health record (EHR) application.        Requirements      Requirements:        An RCI certification in Clinical Psychology.        A minimum of 1 year of experience post-certification.        Proficiency in electronic health record (EHR) applications.        Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team.        Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.        A commitment to uphold CareMe Healths values and standards in providing mental health services.            Benefits        Benefits: As a consultant at CareMe Health, youll enjoy the following benefits:        The opportunity to work alongside a dedicated and diverse team of professionals.        Regular professional development opportunities and training.        Flexible scheduling to promote work-life balance.

column2: Pinnacle Blooms Network is looking for Behavior Modification (Psychologist) to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey"     A behavior modification psychologist is responsible for assessing, analyzing, and modifying behaviors in individuals, often with a focus on addressing maladaptive behaviors or promoting positive behavior change     They utilize principles of behaviorism and evidence-based interventions to develop and implement treatment plans     Key Responsibilities: Assessment:Conduct thorough assessments of individuals to identify target behaviors, antecedents, and consequences     Collect and analyze data related to behavior to establish a baseline and measure progress     Treatment Planning: Develop individualized behavior intervention plans (BIPs) based on assessment findings     Collaborate with clients, families, and other professionals to set realistic goals and objectives     Intervention Implementation: Implement behavior modification techniques and interventions in accordance with established treatment plans     Provide direct behavior therapy sessions to clients, focusing on skill development and behavior change     Data Collection and Analysis:Continuously collect and analyze data to assess the effectiveness of interventions     Make adjustments to treatment plans based on ongoing assessment results     Collaboration:Work closely with other professionals, such as teachers, parents, and healthcare providers, to ensure a coordinated and holistic approach to treatment     Provide training to caregivers and support staff on implementing behavior modification strategies     Documentation and Reporting:Maintain accurate and detailed records of assessments, interventions, and progress     Generate reports summarizing client progress and outcomes     Ethical Standards:Adhere to ethical guidelines and standards in the field of psychology     Maintain confidentiality and respect the rights of clients
column11: Training, Report generation, Skill development, Networking, Psychology, Focus, Data collection, Healthcare

column2: Summary/Objective? Working with EAS provides an opportunity for personal and career growth.?Shadow Therapists with EAS advance their communication, professional, and therapeutic skills while working both individually as well as alongside a team of therapists.?Strong candidates will be able to display a commitment to helping children advance through life by helping them develop to their highest potential.?A shadow therapist does not instruct like a lead teacher does in the classroom, but they provide valuable support to students with different needs. They are expected to be familiar with the students classroom, coursework etc. A shadow therapist acts as a 1:1 teaching aide.   Duties/Responsibilities: Following the student?? Individualized Education Plan and school curriculum Helping and preparing students understand tests, school projects, assignments  Assist in designing and implementing a Behavior Intervention Plan at school and Center Practicing Naturalistic Environment Teaching (NET) in different contexts and locations Collecting data, graphing and assimilating all student related data on the drive Being proactive and pinpointing the student?? needs and supervisors of the same. Monitoring student interactions and using it as a guide to come up with communication/social/group skills targets Integrating the child into social activities with peers and out in the community Data collection and making analytical decisions. Learning strategies and procedures to teach children with developmental delays. Participation in on-going training concerning the fundamentals of ABA Communicating with parents concerning the child?? ABA program, progress and assisting with parent integration  Communicates with parents to inform them of the student?? progress at school and at the center Suggesting appropriate classroom accommodations/ modifications for the student in the school environment Working towards promoting inclusion of the student within the school environment by assisting with participation in all school activities. Creating and utilizing stimuli for the student based on the learning requirements of the student. Required Skills/Abilities: Excellent communication skills. Experience working with young children or children with disabilities is preferred but not required A Registered Behavior Technician (RBT), Applied Behavior Analysis Technician (ABAT) credential is desired but not essential. Clear police and Working with Children checks as well as current first-aid and CPR certificates.? Collaborating with class teachers, school representatives, parents and EAS supervisors and team. Extensive training & knowledge of working with individuals with special needs  Ability to interpret data as needed to set and achieve client goals. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite or similar software. Education and Experience: Bachelor's degree / pursuit of degree in psychology, education, child development, special education or related field. Related experience preferred.
column11: Child Psychology, Occupational Therapy, Autism, Therapy, Communication Skills, Clinical Psychology, Data Collection, Child Development

column2: Company Description Early Autism Services Private Limited (EASPL) is dedicated to providing individualized Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy to children with autism and their families in India. Our programs are based on years of direct experience and the latest research in effective autism treatment. Role Description This is a full-time on-site role for a Behavior Therapist. The Behavior Therapist will be responsible for implementing individualized ABA therapy programs for children with autism. This includes conducting assessments, developing behavior intervention plans, implementing interventions, collecting data, and collaborating with the interdisciplinary team. The Behavior Therapist will also provide support and training to families. Qualifications Knowledge and experience in Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) Familiarity with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and evidence-based interventions Ability to conduct assessments and develop behavior intervention plans Experience in implementing ABA-based interventions and collecting data Excellent observation, problem-solving, and communication skills Ability to work effectively as part of an interdisciplinary team Good organizational and time management skills Patient, compassionate, and understanding attitude Bachelor's or Master's degree in Psychology, Special Education, or a related field Previous experience working with children with autism is a plus
column11: Child Psychology, Occupational Therapy, Autism, Therapy, Clinical Psychology, Data Collection

column2: Athena Behavioural Health is looking for Clinical Psychologist to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Conduct comprehensive psychological evaluations to assess patients' mental health and emotional status      Diagnose and treat patients with a range of mental health and emotional disorders, including anxiety, depression, bipolar disorder, and schizophrenia      Develop and implement treatment plans that are tailored to each patient's unique needs, and that incorporate evidence-based interventions and therapies      Provide individual and group therapy, using a variety of therapeutic approaches, such as cognitive-behavioral therapy, psychoanalytic therapy, and humanistic therapy      Collaborate with other healthcare professionals, such as psychiatrists, social workers, and primary care physicians, to ensure coordinated and comprehensive patient care      Monitor patient progress, and adjust treatment plans as needed to ensure that patients are receiving effective and appropriate care      Maintain accurate and complete patient records, and comply with legal and ethical standards related to patient confidentiality and privacy      Provide education and support to patients and their families, and help them develop coping skills and strategies for managing their mental health and emotional well-being

column2: SRMC University is looking for Assistant Professor in Clinical Psychology to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journeyTeaching and Curriculum Development: Conducting lectures, seminars, and workshops related to clinical psychology, developing course materials, and designing curriculum content      Mentoring and Advising: Guiding students, providing academic support, and supervising research projects or clinical practicum experiences      Research and Publication: Engaging in scholarly research activities, publishing findings in academic journals, and contributing to the advancement of clinical psychology knowledge      Clinical Supervision: Providing supervision and guidance to students in their clinical work, including counseling or therapy sessions, adhering to ethical guidelines      Departmental Service: Participating in departmental meetings, serving on committees, and contributing to academic and administrative tasks within the institution      Qualifications:Education: A PhDor PsyDin Clinical Psychology or a closely related field from an accredited institution      Experience: Prior experience in teaching, research, clinical practice, or a combination thereof is often preferred      Licensure/Certification: Possession of relevant licenses or certifications to practice psychology or teach in a specific region, if required      Key Attributes:Passion for Teaching: Dedication to imparting knowledge and mentoring students in clinical psychology theories, practices, and research methodologies      Research Acumen: Strong research skills, critical thinking, and the ability to contribute to the academic literature in clinical psychology      Clinical Expertise: Experience in clinical practice, with an understanding of therapy techniques, assessment tools, and ethical considerations in counseling or therapy      Communication Skills: Effective verbal and written communication skills to convey complex psychological concepts and research findings to students and colleagues
